intro: Urophyllon caudatum, commonly known as the hairy spur orchid, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, hairy leaves and its unique, spurred orchid flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant grows in wetland habitats, often in swampy or marshy areas, and prefers partial to full shade. Its botanical features include a rhizomatous root system and showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that attract specific pollinators. Urophyllon caudatum is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
